law.catch_line: Requirements and procedures for utilization review -- Exception for private review agent operating under contract with the federal government.

text.section:
KRS 304.17A-600, 304.17A-603, 304.17A-605, 304.17A-607, 304.17A-609, 304.17A-611, 304.17A-613, and 304.17A-615 set forth the requirements and procedures regarding utilization review and shall apply to:
Any insurer or its private review agent that provides or performs utilization review in connection with a health benefit plan or a limited health service benefit plan; and
Any private review agent that performs utilization review functions on behalf of any person providing or administering health benefit plans or limited health service benefit plans.

A private review agent that operates solely under contract with the federal government for utilization review or patients eligible for hospital services under Title XVIII of the Social Security Act shall not be subject to the registration requirements set forth in KRS 304.17A-607, 304.17A-609, and 304.17A-613.

law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 105, sec. 1, effective July 15, 2002. -- Created 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 262, sec. 3, effective July 14, 2000.
